results.content: Wow. Honestly, I only quickly skipped through this one for now. Just because of target usage of SASS/COMPAS I need. It starts with Prepros app, wonderfull thing, worth to pay! Then introduces MATH capabilities, lists and animations (not important for me now, but interesting). Then follows Compass TYPOGRAPHY and SPRITES and COLOR tricks and ends with MEDIA QUERIES. Gotcha; Stunning; THANKS!

results.content:
She showing all the good concepts for CSS  and SASS.
Showing advance topics like Animation which is good to have.

Like how she working from a real life sample and using SASS to solve common problems and improving it next lectures by code refactoring.

Her quick overview for Compass made me comfortable in using it for my next project. Fantastic lectures and highly recommend

results.content: the biggest obstacle with this course is the time you spent on understand the project itself instead of understanding sass because the project is given and you need to read it then you can understand most logical issues buried behind the instrution
results.content_html: the biggest obstacle with this course is the time you spent on understand the project itself instead of understanding sass because the project is given and you need to read it then you can understand most logical issues buried behind the instrution

results.content: I thought this was a great continuation to the previous Step by Step with Sass course.  Clear, easy-to-understand instructions.  The only thing I would have liked to see more of in one of the courses was a little more information on tools.  It was a good start though, and I will be jumping in to further research myself.  Great course, overall!

results.content: I've recently been tasked to learn Compass and SASS at my current position as a UI/UX developer. Lisa's SASS classes give intuitive ways to learn with video, transcripts, and course material to work in. All I can say is BRAVO! Both classes where the best courses I've taken thus far!!
